item.description:
Hi, Everybody:

Looks to be a super fall day out there this weekend - sunny, crisp, cool, no bugs

This time, we'll do an afternoon hike and picnic instead of early morning.  We'll meet at 01:00 and do the Ring Trail loop to the top and back; this takes approximately 1 1/2 hours.  After that we'll hike a short distance across the street and into the woods again (another mile) enjoy a picnic on a quiet pond or under some pine trees - then another shorter walk - and then back. 

Estimated total time of about 3 - 3 1/2 hours and total distance walked of about 5 miles give or take.

This looks to be a great picture taking day so bring your camera along for some photos!  Should be able to see Mount Washington and all the Presidential Range, as well as the ocean on the east side. 

This is an easy to moderate hike.  Some steeper areas.  Elevation is only 691 feet but this is the highest peak in southern Maine so the views are great.Here is the link to the Mount A trail:

http://www.agamenticus.org/recreation.html

Pack a large picnic lunch and beverages:)   Hiking shoes or boots with non-slip grips for slab rocks and pebbles are recommended.  A hiking pole is good for steeper areas for some people.

I'll send along the directions to those who sign up.  For reference purposes, this is 1/2 hour north of Portsmouth, NH.

NOTE:  Please check back the morning of the hike before heading up to be sure that we are still on, as this is subject to at least several of us signing up!  I will update by 07:00 AM Sunday morning.

Randy
item.how_to_find_us: We'll gather near the large rocks at edge of Mount A parking lot.

group.name: North Shore Not Too Intense Hikers

item.name: Hike and Picnic at Mount Agamenticus!
